The source code zip file referred to yesterday contained binary files 
too, and was consequently very large.

A new source code distribution is now available that includes only 
source code, and is the latest version as of today. It has been 
verified to compile 'out of the box' under Windows (Visual C++ 6) and 
linux (g++). It should also compile on any other system with gnu 
compilers, as well as on any SGI system. Solaris and HP-UX may still 
require some porting work. If you port to a new OS, please let me 
know what, if anything, you had to modify. Also, I would encourage 
anyone who is a Mac expert to try porting to the Mac... 

The same source distribution is available in tar and zip formats:

http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera/cantera-1.2-src-042402.tar.gz

http://blue.caltech.edu/cantera/cantera-1.2-src-042402.zip
